title: Printers do not appear to be redirected
author: thedudeiii
body_snippet:
When I connect to my cloud server, I am not getting any of my printers to appear.  My disk drives appear and my "Send to One Note" appears as redirected, but not any of my regular printers.  I have selected "yes" unders printers redirect.

<!--
Only file GitHub issues for bugs and feature requests.  All other topics will be closed.

Before opening an issue, please search for a duplicate or closed issue.
Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue.
-->

<!-- Bug --...

iterations.description: Already resolved by using RDP protocol version 9 (newer mstsclib) as confirmed by last commenter, and RDP protocol improvements were part of our v1.79.0+ releases

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
Tested in 1.75 Beta 3 portable... Printers do not appear to be redirected. However, I only have network printers available. RDP directly (mstsc) also did not redirect the network printers. Will need to review any limitations of this feature.

@thedudeiii - could you please confirm if your printers are local or not? The option within mstsc specifically notes "Local" resources... I'm guessing network resources will not be available.

comments.author: thedudeiii
comments.snippet:
Both actually.  I have a printer that is local and several networked
printers.  None of them appear.

On Wed, Dec 7, 2016 at 4:11 PM, Sean Kaim <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Tested in 1.75 Beta 3 portable... Printers do not appear to be redirected.
> However, I only have network printers available. RDP directly (mstsc) also
> did not redirect the network printers. Will need to review any limitations
> of this feature.
>
> @thedudeiii <https://github.com/thedudeiii> - could you please conf...

comments.author: jemiller226
comments.snippet: Can confirm that this is still an issue in 1.75 Hotfix 1.

comments.author: relativenoob
comments.snippet:
Confirmed still an issue in v1.76.11.40527
Disappointing as this is a crux point for us so we're having to use inferior solutions just because this doesn't work (even though it works in mstsc).

comments.author: Naghual
comments.snippet:
**Still an issue in 1.76.18.26260
Please, correct this bug.**

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
This will very likely rely on #826 being implemented. We just set a switch on the RDP connection to say if we want to redirect printers or not, so this is very likely a bug in the version of the library we are using. 

To fix this, we need to use a newer version of mstsclib. However, using a newer version will start to prevent older operating systems from using RDP from within mRemoteNG (depending on which newer version we select). The best option is to allow mRemoteNG to dynamically determine...

comments.author: xyxzxyz
comments.snippet: I downloaded latest nightly version, changed protocol to rdp 9, printer redirection works now.

notes:
AI triage: Already resolved by using RDP protocol version 9 (newer mstsclib) as confirmed by last commenter, and RDP protocol improvements were part of our v1.79.0+ releases
Approach: No action needed - printer redirection works with RDP 9 protocol which is already available in current releases
